parts.Claim: The death sentence is an outdated punishment and should be seen as unusual.
parts.Data: According to the ACLU, it is a legal relic from when slavery, branding, and corporal punishments were common place.
parts.Warrant: The death penalties archaic legacy is as outdated as other kinds of punishment and should be removed.

parts.Claim: Death sentencing can be very painful, even with modern medicine.
parts.Data: A review of research concluded that: f a member of the execution team injects the drugs into a muscle instead of a vein, or if the needle becomes clogged, extreme pain can result
parts.Warrant: Extreme pain as a kind of punishment is cruel.

parts.Claim: Cruel and unusual punishments are illegal in the United States.
parts.Data: The 8th amendment states: 'Excessive bail shall not be required, nor excessive fines imposed, nor cruel and unusual punishments inflicted.'
parts.Warrant: The above two arguments prove that capital punishment is both cruel and unusual, so it should be illegal.

parts.Claim: Lawyers, courts, courtrooms, and judges are all limited resources.
parts.Data: Each group has limited number of staff, and time.
parts.Warrant: Like any person or worker, they can only do so much work per day.

parts.Claim: Legal resources on capital punishment cases take time.
parts.Data: Often, capital punishment cases are repeatedly accused of mistrial or are appealed.
parts.Warrant: Repeatedly trying a case takes work hours each time.

parts.Claim: The legal resources spent on capital punishment cases clog up the legal system.
parts.Data: Courtrooms, public defense lawyers, judges all could be used for other cases.
parts.Warrant: The legal resources that goes to death penalty cases come at the cost of other court cases.

3.content: Death Penalty is Inaccurate and Unethical

parts.Claim: Not everyone who is sentenced to the death penalty is guilty.
parts.Data: A 2014 study by Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences suggests 1 in 25 death sentence are wrong.
parts.Warrant: We can trust this study because it was published in a peer reviewed journal.,

parts.Claim: Sometimes the death penalty is used on innocent people
parts.Data: If you are not guilty then you are innocent.
parts.Warrant: Given that not everyone who is sentenced is guilty, some innocent people must be killed.

parts.Claim: Wrongly killing innocent people is unethical.
parts.Data: It harms people who didnâ€™t do anything wrong.
parts.Warrant: Hurting people for no reason is unethical.
